an8.69:4.3: The assemblies of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, and ascetics. An assembly of the gods under the Four Great Kings. An assembly of the gods under the Thirty-three. An assembly of Māras. An assembly of Brahmās.
an8.69:4.4: I recall having approached an assembly of hundreds of aristocrats.
an8.69:4.5: There I used to sit with them, converse, and engage in discussion.
an8.69:4.6: And my appearance and voice became just like theirs.
an8.69:4.7: I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dharma talk.
an8.69:4.8: But when I spoke they didn’t know:
an8.69:4.9: ‘Who is this that speaks? Is it a god or a human?’
an8.69:4.10: And when my Dharma talk was finished I vanished.
an8.69:4.11: But when I vanished they didn’t know:
an8.69:4.12: ‘Who is this that has vanished? Is it a god or a human?’
